content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are very careful and tend to avoid risks. You prefer to take a conservative approach and avoid uncertainties. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a careful and conservative undergraduate student, I would choose to minimize the risk of losing money over the course of 75 rounds. Since choosing R consistently gives me a higher payoff when my opponent chooses B (42$ versus 0$), and since my opponent could potentially be acting in a similar manner, it seems reasonable to expect that they might also choose R more often than B to avoid losing money. By choosing R, I increase the likelihood of getting a consistent payout of 45$ per round when my opponent also chooses R. Although choosing B would yield a higher total payout if my opponent consistently chooses R (1740$ versus 675$), the risk of losing a significant amount of money in the long run seems too high for me. Therefore, I will choose R{R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In this scenario, both me and my opponent have chosen R, resulting in a payout of 45$ for each of us. If we are rational players, we should consider our past choices and adjust our strategies accordingly to maximize our earnings over the course of multiple rounds. Since I have already chosen R once and received a payout of 45$, I can expect that my opponent might choose B on their next turn in order to get a higher payout (42$ versus 0$). To minimize this risk, I should consider choosing B in the next round to potentially get a higher payout for myself (42$ versus 12$). Therefore, I will choose B{B}.
